title: 112_hr3163
content: The "Easy Voting Act of 2011" establishes a minimum early voting period for jurisdictions conducting early voting, amending the Help America Vote Act of 2002 to include new requirements for states permitting early voting. The "Easy Voting Act of 2011" requires states to provide a 14-day early voting period for federal elections starting January 1, 2012. Amendments are made to ensure compliance with the new requirements. SEC. 303B prohibits states from requiring state-issued identification for voting or registering to vote. SEC. 303B prohibits election officials from mandating state-issued identification for voting or voter registration for Federal elections, effective January 1, 2012. SEC. 303C requires states to offer same-day voter registration and change of address services on election day. SEC. 303C mandates states to allow same-day voter registration and address changes on election day, bypassing certain requirements of the National Voter Registration Act of 1993. SEC. 303C mandates states to allow same-day voter registration and address changes on election day. If a registered voter in a State moves to a new address but does not update their information before voting, they can provide the new address at the polling place using a form developed by the State and cast a regular ballot instead of a provisional one. SEC. 303C requires states to permit same-day voter registration and address changes on election day. A registered voter can update their address at the polling place using a form provided by the State and vote with a regular ballot instead of a provisional one. SEC. 303C requires states to allow same-day voter registration and address changes on election day. The polling place official must transmit voter registration or change of address forms to the State election official along with the cast ballots. Compliance with these requirements begins on January 1, 2012. Section 303C of the Act requires states to allow same-day voter registration and address changes on election day, including at early voting sites. Compliance with these requirements begins on January 1, 2012.
